newsitem.title: USA: US mutual fund co. developing anti-smoke web site.
newsitem.headline: US mutual fund co. developing anti-smoke web site.

text.p: A mutual fund company focused on "socially-responsible" investing said Wednesday it was developing a Web site to allow investors to check whether their mutual funds contained tobacco stocks.
Calvert Group, based in Bethesda, Md., planned to hold a media briefing Nov. 19 at which a live demonstration of the first such Web site would be given, an advisory about the briefing said.
Calvert Group with $5 billion in assets under management does not invest in tobacco, alcohol or gambling related firms.
The Web site will allow investors to plug in the name of a mutual fund to determine if it holds tobacco stocks, the advisory said.

Dozens of anti-smoking organizations will join the mutual fund company in an effort to help investors determine if their mutual funds contain tobacco stocks and to persuade employers to offer a tobacco-free retirement plan option, the advisory said.
The briefing will be held the same week as the "Great American Smokeout" scheduled Nov. 21, when smokers are challenged to quit for a day.
